author: lundblad
msg: Introduce an svn_ra_reparent call that makes it possible to
give an existing RA session a new parent URL (in the same repository).
The motivation for this change is to avoid opening lots of RA sessions
for one operation, which can be costly depending on the RA layer in use
(e.g. establishing SSL or SSH connections).  This commit also makes use
of the new API to get rid of this problem in many cases.  For example,
a repos->repos diff used to open five RA sessions, and now opens two
instead.  Most svn operations required an extra RA session just to get the
correct repository URL for a path@rev, which isn't necessary any longer.
For ra_dav, this is entirely a client operation, so there are no
compatibility concerns.  For ra_svn, a new command reparent was added
to svnserve.  If this command isn't supported, a new connection is
(svn_ra_local__open): Allocate repository_URL and fs_path in the new
(open_session): New function, mostly factored out of ra_svn_open.
(ra_svn_open): Use open_session to do the actual work.  Open the session
in a subpool of the RA session pool.
(find_repos): Initialize the baton's path_pool and allocate fs_path
(parse_url): New function, factored out of svn_ra_dav__open.
(svn_ra_dav__open): Use parse_url.  Initialize the session url_pool and
(same_resource_in_head): Add ra_session argument and use it instead of
(svn_client_info): Pass the RA session to same_resource_in_head.
(svn_client__repos_locations): Add ra_session argument and use it
if possible instead of opening a temporary session.
(svn_client__ra_session_from_path): Open the RA session before getting the
repos locations, so we don't need a temporary session for that purpose,
and reparent the session before returning it.
(diff_prepare_repos_repos): Rework to only use one RA session for everything.
Pass that RA session to the caller.
by diff_prepare_repos_repos instead of opening another one.
